{"step_by_step_thinking": "The level of fluoride in a community water fluoridation program is not dependent on the economic factors of the area, the average weight of the children, or the altitude of the area above sea level. These factors do not directly influence the amount of fluoride that is added to the water. However, the mean annual temperature of the place can affect the amount of water people drink. In warmer climates, people tend to drink more water, so the fluoride concentration might need to be lower to prevent excessive fluoride intake.", "answer_choice": "A"}
